title: 107_s1042
content: The Act titled "Filipino Veterans' Benefits Improvements Act of 2001" establishes the rate of payment for certain benefits for new Philippine Scouts residing in the United States. Section 107 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to redesignate provisions and adjust the rate of payment for benefits. Amendments to section 107 of title 38, United States Code include inserting "or (b)" after "subsection (a)" and replacing "subsection (a)" with "the applicable subsection". The effective date for these changes is the date of enactment of the Act, applying to benefits paid from that date onwards. SEC. 3 amends the rate of payment for dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses of certain Filipino veterans under title 38, United States Code. The effective date is the enactment date and applies to benefits from that point onwards. SEC. 4 addresses the eligibility of certain Filipino veterans for disability pension. The eligibility criteria for certain Filipino veterans under title 38, United States Code is amended to include specific subsections and chapters. Additionally, the rate of payment for dependency and indemnity compensation is adjusted for surviving spouses. The eligibility criteria for Filipino veterans under title 38, United States Code is amended to include specific subsections and chapters. The rate of payment for benefits under chapter 15 is adjusted based on the recipient's residency. The amendments made by this section will take effect upon the enactment of the Act. SEC. 5 amends section 1734 of title 38 to provide health care for Filipino veterans in the US. SEC. 6 addresses outpatient care for veterans in the Philippines. Section 1735 of title 38, United States Code, provides outpatient care and services for World War II veterans residing in the Philippines. The Secretary is required to furnish care for service-connected and nonservice-connected disabilities at the Manila VA Outpatient Clinic, with a yearly expenditure limit of $500,000. In any fiscal year, the purpose of subsection (a) is limited to $500,000. The Secretary can provide care and services under subsection (a) only if appropriations are available. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in chapter 17 of the title. The amendments made by this section regarding outpatient care for World War II veterans in the Philippines will take effect upon the enactment of the Act.
